result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Matthew R Bernas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).
  • Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st) (PAC<0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Comply with conditions as listed in the DPA and comply with conditions of probation as listed in Counts 2 & 3. If successful, the State will file a dismissal order.

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dismissed with Prejudice
*Reason:  Defendant has successfully completed all conditions of the deferred judgment

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Comply and participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Write an apology letter to each of the 3 passengers, provide to agent first within 60 days.
Restitution TBD with in 30 days, if objections can then be heard at a restitution hearing by the CC.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Comply with conditions as listed in Count 2.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:50 a.m. Defendant Matthew R Bernas in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed and reading is waived. Count 3 is added.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Ct 1 requested 24 months DPA, Ct 2 & 3 requested to be W/H Probation for 24 months w/conditions
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Ct 1, 2 & 3: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Cts 1, 2, &3.  Clerk directed to (withhold entry) of Judgment of Conviction this date on Count 1. Clerk is to enter Judgment of Conviction on Counts 2 & 3. Court signs DPA for Count 1.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments and informs the Court that victim notification has been complied with.
Atty Sheets concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:****PROBATION Ct 2 & 3***
Count 1: 24 months Deferred Prosecution Agreement (DPA) - JusticeWorks
Comply with conditions as listed in the DPA and comply with conditions of probation as listed in Counts 2 & 3. If successful, the State will file a dismissal order.

Count 2: W/H Sentence 24 months Probation
Conditions:
$300 fine + costs = $631.00
100 hrs of Community Services.
30 days jail, 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Comply and participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Write an apology letter to each of the 3 passengers, provide to agent first within 60 days.
Restitution TBD with in 30 days, if objections can then be heard at a restitution hearing by the CC.

Count 3:  W/H Sentence 24 months Probation, concurrent with Count 2
Conditions:
$300 fine + costs = $631.00
30 days jail, concurrent with Count 2.
Comply with conditions as listed in Count 2.
Motion hearing on April 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Matthew R Bernas in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

4:11 PM Court calls case.
Matter is set for a motion hearing this afternoon.
Court states appearances.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, matter is set for a trial in the first week of May. Atty Cousins filed a motion in liminie. Atty Sheets has filed several motions in limine. Parties are prepared to argue.

Atty Sheets addresses the Court, was of the understanding this hearing was set just to hear the State's motion only.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, apologizes for getting copy of motion to Atty Sheets late.

Parties continue regarding hearing the motions. 
Court suggests a different date to reschedule these if they choose to.

Parties are in agreement to reschedule this motion hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Atty Sheets - request to reschedule trial

DA's Request for a Subpoena for Documents Pursuant to  WIS STAT 968.135 and a Motion for Orders Regulating Production, Preservation, and Maintenance of Documents, Subpoenas for Records Pursuant to WIS STAT 968.135 /s/ RJS 10/21/15, Affidavit in Support or Subpoena for Documents and Return of Subpoena for Documents Issued Under WIS STAT 968.135 **Medical Records for Brian Dallman maintained by Aspirus Wausau Hospital (confidential)

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

State recommends a $5,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Matthew R Bernas in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Request for Subpoena, Affidavit in Support, Subpoena of Records, and Return of Subpoena
